website_summaries.verdict: Bargain price stand that’s a popular choice for kids and teens.
pros: Folds compactly and can fit into a backpack
Easy to assemble – even a kid can do it
Zero complaints about stability or security
cons: Though portable, doesn't include a bag for transport

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and budget friendly
customer_reviews.text: A good solution when you need 3 or 4 instruments ready to go. Minor complain, the sax supports are exactly the same size, you assemble them with the alto lower support in the upper recess and the tenor lower support in the lower recess. This works well for the saxes' differing lengths, but the bell support on the one you use for tenor is made to fit the alto and is too tight to allow easy in and out for the tenor. Expect to have to bend this one slightly to make it fit the tenor bell.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Gordley

customer_reviews.title: This sax stand does not fit my Yamaha Tenor sax too well.
customer_reviews.text: I disliked the fact that it was advertised for alto or tenor saxophone but it is a bit too tight around the bell for my Yamaha tenor sax. I can't imagine how it would hold a Selmel sax or a Conn.
customer_reviews.author: S. Giuffrida

customer_reviews.title: It’s was okay
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t expecting something out of this world considering the price but it definitely got the job done. I needed a stand for an alto sax and soprano sax. Of course the peg isn’t designed for a soprano so it didn’t stand well but like I said it got the job done. As for the alto stand the padding did start to come off after about a month but I never had an issue with the sax falling so I’d say I got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Scratched the horn
customer_reviews.text: The tenor sax is held in almost a vertical position. The part that cradles the bell holds the horn tight via friction. One of the protective caps popped off, exposing the hard plastic underneath. This caused a small scratch in at the top of the bell. I have not tried it with my alto sax.
customer_reviews.author: Frank G. Pratt III

customer_reviews.title: Great stand
customer_reviews.text: PROS: supports saxophone can hold clarinet/ soprano saxophone on peg CONS: peg isn’t protected, so might leave scratches on soprano saxophone doesn’t fold up great for travel or storage VERDICT: a great stand for a good price
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Tenor Sax Doesn't Work in this Stand
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my father, and would have returned it had he communicated that it wasn't working sooner. The part that hold the bell of the sax is too tight, so when one lifts the sax off of the stand, the sax comes with it. Someone bumped into it and the sax fell right over, so now, not only can I not return the stand, but I have a sax to find a repair shop for. Don't waste your money, this one is not a good solution.
customer_reviews.author: Lori D. Yount

customer_reviews.title: Bad Design.
customer_reviews.text: The design of this product is unacceptable. It has left severe scratches on the Saxophone bell. Stay away from this junk.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: For the price I expected it to be flimsy but it was much heavier and better built than I expected. A value buy for sure. I use it to hold my Tenor Sax and a clarinet. Always wanted one.
customer_reviews.author: McDermittMarvel

customer_reviews.title: Easy put together; for both saxophone and clarinet
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old loves this stand for his alto saxophone. He put it together by himself and uses it a lot. Bonus is that his older brother can use it for his clarinet. It’s sturdy and seems well made. I’m sure we’ll use it for many years to come. Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: InaN

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and delivery
customer_reviews.text: My 12 year old niece was delighted with this and could not wait to get home and set it uo.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi P.

customer_reviews.title: Great stand
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job. Was cheaper than a local music store
customer_reviews.author: KermitFrog

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and as described. I do not worry about my saxophone falling off at all. So far so good
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tenor sax stand
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly, nice and stable. My kids put it together in about 30 seconds! We use it for both a sax and trumpet (on the peg) and it is very handy to have around for daily practice!
customer_reviews.author: Across the Pond

customer_reviews.title: Folds nicely to fit in her music bag to carry with ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter for matching and season to hold her tenor saxaphone and her oboe for a solo. Folds nicely to fit in her music bag to carry with her to practice.
customer_reviews.author: dogmom

customer_reviews.title: Well built and easy to transport
customer_reviews.text: Great stand that just needed the bell holder opened up about 3mm. Easy to take to gigs and has a small(ish) but still wide enough footprint on the bandstand
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Works great with My Alto and flute
customer_reviews.text: Folds up nicely to fit in a duffel bag for gigs.
customer_reviews.author: Aldo Fucinari

customer_reviews.title: Great stand.
customer_reviews.text: Seems very stable, even on carpet at home for practice. Haven’t taken it on a gig yet - that comes next week. So far, a great stand.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Martin, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great sax stand
customer_reviews.text: Great stand for the money. I rest my Yamaha 62 on a daily basis on it. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Sugar Sheffield

customer_reviews.title: Well Built
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built baritone saxophone stand. It folds compact and fits into a back pack or medium duffle bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This stand does the job.
customer_reviews.text: This stand is not fancy, just basic , however it does the job for alto or tenor sax and flute or clarinet on the peg, does not tip over easily and is not flimsy in its construction. Good stand in my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Charles E. Rey

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Convenient
customer_reviews.text: Just what the doctor ordered as I alternate between clarinet and alto sax. Decently built & sturdy. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Straka

product_meta.title: Audio2000'S AST4501 Alto/Tenor Saxophone Stand with Detachable Flute/Clarinet Peg
product_meta.description: Style:WITH CLARINETE PEGThe Audio2000'S tm AST4501 is a premium alto/tenor saxophone stand. It also has a detachable flute/clarinet peg.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars85 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
